block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Nassau and Suffolk Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com, or by mail to Long Island Weekly, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
MUSIC AND DANCE
Bay Shore The Brasil Guitar Duo. April 7 at 8 p.m. Free. Boulton Center for the Performing Arts, 37 West Main Street. (631) 969-1101.

Brookville Works by Mozart and Salieri, presented by the Long Island Philharmonic, with Pip Clarke, violin. April 1 at 7:30 p.m. $34 to $68. Tilles Center for the Performing Arts, 720 Northern Boulevard, C. W. Post Campus, Long Island University. (516) 299-3100.
Centerport Gordon Bok, 12-string guitar. April 7 at 7:30 p.m. $20; members, $15. Congregational Church of Huntington, 30 Washington Drive. (631) 425-2925.

Farmingdale Body Count and Ice T with Constricted and Remains of the Fallen, hard rock. April 1 at 6 p.m. $15 to $17. Necro and others, hip-hop. Wednesday at 6 p.m. $16 to $18. Almost Queen and Rocket Man, tribute bands. Thursday at 7 p.m. $13 to $15. Crazy Donkey, 1058 Route 110. (631) 753-1975.
Garden City The Kennedys, folk. Friday at 8 p.m. $15. Unitarian Universalist Church of Central Nassau, 223 Stewart Avenue. (516) 248-8855.
Huntington George Winston, contemporary piano. April 7 at 8 p.m. $45; members, $34. Inter-Media Art Center, 370 New York Avenue. (631) 549-2787.
Huntington Lucie Blue Tremblay, singer-songwriter. April 7 at 8 p.m. $20. Unitarian Universalist Fellowship at Huntington, 109 Browns Road. (631) 427-9547.
Long Beach ''Rodgers, Hammerstein and Hart Songbook,'' presented by the Dianne Hoffman Quartet. April 1 at 2 p.m. Free. Long Beach Public Library, 111 West Park Avenue. (516) 432-7201.
Patchogue Live in the Lobby: The Blur Division, jazz. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. $5. Patchogue Theater for the Performing Arts, 71 East Main Street. (631) 207-1313.
Shelter Island Juniata College Choir. April 1 at 1:30 p.m. Free. Presbyterian Church of Shelter Island, Route 114. (631) 749-1488.

Smithtown ''English Country Dance,'' presented by the Long Island Traditional Music Association; open to all ages and experience levels. April 1 at 2 p.m. $14; members, $10. Smithtown Masonic Temple, 34 River Road. (631) 757-3627.

Westbury Wayne Newton. April 1 at 3 p.m. $51.50 to $61.50. Mannheim Steamroller, classical rock. Wednesday at 8 p.m. $50 to $60. Taylor Hicks, singer-songwriter. April 7 at 8 p.m. $39.50 to $49.50. North Fork Theater, 960 Brush Hollow Road. (516) 334-0800.
THEATER
East Farmingdale ''This Is Our Youth'' by Kenneth Lonergan. Through April 22. $18 to $22. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.
East Islip ''Lovers and Other Strangers,'' comedy by Renée Taylor and Joseph Bologna. Friday through April 22. $14 to $22. BayWay Arts Center, 265 East Main Street. (631) 581-2700.
Elmont ''Crossing Delancey,'' comedy by Susan Sandler. Through April 1. $25; seniors, $22; children 16 and under, $14. BroadHollow Theater, 700 Hempstead Turnpike. (631) 581-2700.

Lindenhurst ''Beau Jest,'' comedy by James Sherman, presented by BroadHollow Theater Company. Through April 15. $22; seniors, $20; children under 16, $14. Studio Theater, 141 South Wellwood Avenue. (631) 581-2700.
Oakdale ''Miss Saigon,'' musical by Claude-Michel Schonberg and Alain Boublil. Through April 1. $20; seniors, $18; students, $16. CM Performing Arts Center, 931 Montauk Highway. (631) 218-2810.
Quogue ''Breaking Legs'' by Tom Dulack, presented by the Hampton Theater Company. Through April 1. $10. Quogue Community Hall, 126 Jessup Avenue. (631) 653-8955.
FILM
Cutchogue North Fork Film Festival: ''Binta and the Great Idea,'' directed by Javier Fesser. April 7 at 7 p.m. $12. Castello di Borghese Vineyard, County Road 48 and Alvah's Lane. (631) 734-5111.
FOR CHILDREN

East Farmingdale ''Cinderella, Cinderella,'' audience-participation musical based on the classic fairytale. All ages. Through April 1. $8. ''Velveteen Rabbit,'' adapted from the story by Margery Williams. April 7 through May 27. $8. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.

Garden City ''Short Films Festival for Families,'' films by independent filmmakers. Ages 3 and up. Monday at 1 and 3 p.m. $5; $3 with museum admission. ''The Art of Henri Matisse.'' Ages 6 to 12. Monday at 12:30 and 2:30 p.m. $3 with museum admission, $2 for members. ''Perfecting Pop: The Art of Andy Warhol.'' Ages 6 and 12. Tuesday at 12:30 and 2:30 p.m. $3 with museum admission, $2 for members. ''A Day at the Beach,'' presented by Bari Koral Family Rock Band. Ages 3 and up. Tuesday and Wednesday at 1 and 3 p.m. $5; $3 with museum admission. ''Kailani,'' traditional Hawaiian hula and steel guitar presented by Olivia Iolani and Chris Merwin. Ages 3 and up. Thursday and Friday at 1 and 3 p.m. $5; $3 with museum admission. Long Island Children's Museum, 11 Davis Avenue. (516) 224-5800.

Kings Park ''World in a Bottle.'' Make a terrarium; bring two-liter bottle with screw top. All ages. Thursday at 2 p.m. $3; children, $2; reservations required. Nissequogue River State Park, St. Johnland Road. (631) 269-4927.
Lindenhurst ''Mr. Easter Bunny,'' children's theater. April 7 at 2 p.m. $8. Studio Theater, 141 South Wellwood Avenue. (631) 581-2700.

Oakdale ''The Extraordinary Egg.'' Bring two hard-boiled eggs per child. Ages 5 and up. Wednesday at 1:30 p.m. ''Wearable Art.'' Design your own ''nature shirt'' with paint and stamps; bring a T-shirt. All ages. Thursday at 10 a.m. ''April Showers Bring May Flowers.'' Walk to observe blooming flowers. Ages 5 and up. Friday at 9:30 a.m. All: $3; children, $2; reservations required. Connetquot River State Park, Sunrise Highway. (631) 581-1005.

Oyster Bay ''Eggs-stravaganza!'' Learn about nests and search for animals' hidden ''eggs.'' April 7: Ages 2 to 4, 11:30 to 11:45 a.m.; ages 5 to 10, noon to 12:15 p.m. $8; members, $5. Theodore Roosevelt Sanctuary and Audubon Center, 134 Cove Road. (516) 922-3200.
Riverhead ''Spring Break Dino Days,'' art and science activities. Monday through Friday. Hours: Daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Dinosaur Walk Museum, 221 East Main Street. (631) 369-6556.

Smithtown ''April Fools.'' Learn tricks animals use to protect themselves. April 1 at 1:30 p.m. ''Native-American Games.'' Learn and play traditional games. Ages 5 and up. Wednesday at 10:30 a.m. ''Spring Has Sprung.'' Explore how plants and animals change during this season. Thursday at 10 a.m. ''All About Eggs.'' Bring two hard-boiled eggs per child. April 6 at 10 a.m. All: Ages 5 and up; $3; children, $2; reservations required. Caleb Smith State Park Preserve, Jericho Turnpike. (631) 265-1054.

Southampton ''Masters of Art in Everyday Life.'' Learn about famous artists and their work and create your own project. Ages 4 to 14. Monday through Friday, 10 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. and 1:30 to 4 p.m. $28; members, $18. ''Imagination in Motion,'' family performance presented by Rajeckas and Intraub Movement Theater. April 7 at 2 p.m. $8; members, $3. Parrish Art Museum, 25 Job's Lane. (631) 283-2118,Extension 32.
OUTDOORS
Captree Island ''Evening Lighthouse Tower Tour.'' April 1 at 6 p.m. $10; reservations required. Fire Island Lighthouse Preservation Society, 4640 Captree Island. (631) 661-4876.

Cutchogue ''Winemaker's Walk.'' Tour the vineyard and learn about grapes and winemaking. April 7 at 1 p.m. $15; reservations required. Castello di Borghese Vineyard, County Road 48 and Alvah's Lane. (631) 734-5111.

Huntington ''History of Caumsett.'' Adult nature hike exploring the park's history. April 1 at 2 p.m. ''Just a Hike.'' Adult nature hike along six-mile trail. April 8 at 9:45 a.m. Both: $3; reservations required. Caumsett State Historic Park, 25 Lloyd Harbor Road. (631) 423-1770.
SPOKEN WORD

Setauket Poetryvolg.org's First Anniversary Party and National Poetry Month Celebration; poetry readings, music and reception. April 7, 5 to 8 p.m. $20. Setauket Neighborhood House, 95 Main Street. (631) 751-3730.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES
Bellport ''Spring 2007 Exhibition,'' paintings by various artists. Through April 30. Hours: Saturdays, 1 to 5 p.m. Ratio Gallery, 10 Bell Street. (631) 286-4020.

Cold Spring Harbor ''Toys, Kids and Boats,'' exhibition of children's toys from the whaling era. Through Aug. 31. $4; seniors and students, $3; children under 5, free. Whaling Museum, Route 25A. (631) 367-3418.
Dix Hills ''Visionary Anatomies,'' works by 11 artists inspired by human anatomical imagery. April 7 through May 31. Jeanie Tengelsen Gallery, 107 East Deer Park Road. (631) 462-5400.
East Hampton ''Early Spring Show,'' works by nine furniture makers. Through May 22. Pritam and Eames, 29 Race Lane. (631) 324-7111.

East Hampton Paintings and mixed media works by Peter Dayton, Robert Kelly, Rex Lau, Alan Shields and Kelly Spalding. Through April 30. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. The Drawing Room, 16R Newtown Lane. (631) 324-5016.

East Islip ''Surface Impressions,'' works by artists exploring the idea of surface in canvas, sculpture and mixed-media. Wednesday through June 3. Donation: $3. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Islip Art Museum, 50 Irish Lane. (631) 224-5402.

Huntington ''Oaxacan Wood Carvings Show.'' Through April 15. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Fridays, 10 a.m. to 7 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Adobe Artes, 26 Gerard Street. (631) 385-8410.
Huntington ''Unlikely Materials,'' works by various artists. Through April 28. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Alpan Gallery, 2 West Carver Street. (631) 423-4433.

Huntington ''Now and Then,'' photographs by various artists. Through April 1. Free. ''Bébé Identity,'' photographs by Richard Gardner. Friday through April 29. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 9 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Fotofoto Gallery, 372 New York Avenue. (631) 549-0448.

Huntington Station ''Inner and Outer Weather,'' paintings by Peter Galasso. Through April 13. Hours: Mondays, Tuesdays and Fridays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. South Huntington Public Library, 145 Pidgeon Hill Road. (631) 549-4411.

Melville ''Fresh Air,'' works by Sanford Forrester, Barbara Gruber, Donald Thiergard, and M. Ellen Winter. Through June 4. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. Art-trium, 25 Melville Park Road. (631) 271-8423.

Oakdale ''The Living Classroom: Now Present at this Moment,'' multi-media installations by Ahn Pilyun. Through April 29. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Anthony Giordano Gallery, Dowling College, Idle Hour Boulevard. (631) 244-3016.

Quogue ''Local Color,'' works by Carolyn Munoco Haines and Meryl Spiegel. Through April 30. Reception: April 7, 3 to 5 p.m. Hours: Sundays and Mondays, noon to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Quogue Library Art Gallery, 90 Quogue Street. (631) 653-4224.
Riverhead Caroline M. Bell and the Peconic Bay Impressionists. Through April 30. Suffolk County Historical Society, 300 West Main Street. (631) 727-2881.

Roslyn Harbor ''Rembrandt to Rosenquist: The Masters of Printmaking.'' Through May 13. ''Twenty-First Century Prints,'' works by Elizabeth Peyton, John Currin and other contemporary printmakers. Through May 13. Admission: $4 to $10; children under 5 and members, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4:45 p.m. Nassau County Museum of Art, 1 Museum Drive. (516) 484-9337.

Sag Harbor ''Erotic Art Show,'' works by Alberta Elia, William Negron and others. Through May 24. Hours: Mondays and Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 7 p.m. Winter Tree Gallery, 125 Main Street. (631) 725-0097.

St. James ''28th Annual Juried Photography Exhibition.'' Through May 4. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Mills Pond House Gallery, 660 Route 25A. (631) 862-6575.

Stony Brook ''Living the American Dream: Levittown and the Suburban Boom,'' exhibition exploring the history of suburbanization on Long Island. Through July 8. ''William Sidney Mount: The Education of an Artist,'' Mount's paintings are paired with works that inspired them. Through Sept. 30. $7; seniors, $6; students, $3. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages, 1200 Route 25A. (631) 751-0066.

Stony Brook ''Spring Art and Craft Fair,'' works by more than 90 artists. April 1, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. $5; children under 12, free. Sports Complex, Nicholls Road, Stony Brook University. (631) 563-8551.

Uniondale ''Paper Tapestries,'' works made of woven paper by Sage Reynolds. April 1 through April 30. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Fridays, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Uniondale Public Library, 400 Uniondale Avenue. (516) 489-2220.
West Hills Photographs by George Mallis. Through April 15. $3. Walt Whitman Birthplace State Historic Site and Interpretive Center, 246 Old Walt Whitman Road. (631) 427-5240.

Quogue ''Breaking Legs'' by Tom Dulack, presented by the Hampton Theater Company. Through April 1. $10. Quogue Community Hall, 126 Jessup Avenue. (631) 653-8955.

Cutchogue North Fork Film Festival: ''Binta and the Great Idea,'' directed by Javier Fesser. April 7 at 7 p.m. $12. Castello di Borghese Vineyard, County Road 48 and Alvah's Lane. (631) 734-5111.

Hours: Mondays, Tuesdays and Fridays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. South Huntington Public Library, 145 Pidgeon Hill Road. Reception: April 7, 3 to 5 p.m. Hours: Sundays and Mondays, noon to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Quogue Library Art Gallery, 90 Quogue Street. (631) 653-4224.

Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages, 1200 Route 25A. (631) 751-0066.

Stony Brook ''Spring Art and Craft Fair,'' works by more than 90 artists. April 1, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. $5; children under 12, free. Sports Complex, Nicholls Road, Stony Brook University. (631) 563-8551.

Uniondale ''Paper Tapestries,'' works made of woven paper by Sage Reynolds. April 1 through April 30. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Fridays, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Uniondale Public Library, 400 Uniondale Avenue. (516) 489-2220.
West Hills Photographs by George Mallis. Through April 15. $3. Walt Whitman Birthplace State Historic Site and Interpretive Center, 246 Old Walt Whitman Road. (631) 427-5240.
